armchair.meanings: A chair with supports for the arms or elbows.

armed.meanings: To take by the arm; to take up in one's arms.

army.meanings: A large, highly organized military force, concerned mainly with ground (rather than air or naval) operations.

aroma.meanings: A smell; especially a pleasant spicy or fragrant one.

around.meanings: (with the verb "to be") Present in the vicinity.

arrange.meanings: To set up; to organize; to put into an orderly sequence or arrangement.

arrangement.definition: 準備工作,排列,佈置,契約,協定

arrest.meanings: A check, stop, an act or instance of arresting something.

arrival.meanings: The act of arriving or something that has arrived.

arrive.meanings: To reach; to get to a certain place.

arrogant.meanings: Having excessive pride in oneself, often with contempt or disrespect for others.

arrow.meanings: A projectile consisting of a shaft, a point and a tail with stabilizing fins that is shot from a bow.

art.meanings: The conscious production or arrangement of sounds, colours, forms, movements, or other elements in a manner that affects the senses and emotions, usually specifically the production of the beautiful in a graphic or plastic medium.

article.meanings: A piece of nonfictional writing such as a story, report, opinion piece, or entry in a newspaper, magazine, journal, dictionary, encyclopedia, etc.

articulate.meanings: An animal of the subkingdom Articulata.

artillery.meanings: Large cannon-like weapons, transportable and usually operated by more than one person.

artwork.meanings: A painting, drawing, sculpture or other piece of creative, visual art

as if.meanings: As though; in a manner suggesting.

as long as.meanings: Provided that, if, assuming (depending upon some condition or requirement).

as of.meanings: At or by a specified time, with the implication that the said condition will be true from that time onward.

as.meanings: To such an extent or degree; to the same extent or degree.

ascend.meanings: To move upward, to fly, to soar.

ascertain.meanings: To find out definitely; to discover or establish.

ascribe.meanings: To attribute a cause or characteristic to someone or something.

ash.meanings: The solid remains of a fire.

ashamed.meanings: To feel shame; to be ashamed.

aside.meanings: An incidental remark made quietly so as to be heard by the person to whom it is said and not by any others in the vicinity.

ask.meanings: An act or instance of asking.

asleep.meanings: In a state of sleep; also, broadly, resting.

aspect.meanings: Any specific feature, part, or element of something.
aspect.definition: 方面,層面,朝向,方向,外表,外觀

aspiration.meanings: The act of aspiring or ardently desiring; an ardent wish or desire, chiefly after what is elevated or spiritual (with common adjunct adpositions being to and of).

aspiring.meanings: To have a strong desire or ambition to achieve something.

ass.meanings: Any of several species of horse-like animals, especially Equus asinus, the domesticated of which are used as beasts of burden.

assault.meanings: A violent onset or attack with physical means, for example blows, weapons, etc.

assembly.meanings: A set of pieces that work together in unison as a mechanism or device.

assert.meanings: An assertion; a section of source code which tests whether an expected condition is true.

assertion.meanings: The act of asserting; positive declaration or averment.

assertive.meanings: Boldly self-assured; confident without being aggressive.

asset.meanings: Something or someone of any value; any portion of one's property or effects so considered.
asset.definition: 資產,寶貴的人材,有價值的物品

assignment.meanings: The act of assigning; the allocation of a job or a set of tasks.

assimilate.meanings: Something that is or has been assimilated.

assist.meanings: A helpful action or an act of giving.

assistance.meanings: Aid; help; the act or result of assisting.

assistant.meanings: Someone who is present; a bystander, a witness.

associate.meanings: A person united with another or others in an act, enterprise, or business; a partner.

assorted.meanings: To sort or arrange according to characteristic or class.

assume.meanings: To authenticate by means of belief; to surmise; to suppose to be true, especially without proof

assurance.meanings: The act of assuring; a declaration tending to inspire full confidence; that which is designed to give confidence.

asteroid.meanings: Any member of the taxonomic class Asteroidea; a starfish

astral.meanings: Relating to or resembling the stars; starry.

astronaut.meanings: A member of the crew of a spaceship or other spacecraft that travels beyond Earth's atmosphere, or someone trained to serve that purpose.

astronomer.meanings: One who studies astronomy, the stars or the physical universe; a scientist whose area of research is astronomy or astrophysics

astronomy.meanings: The study of the physical universe beyond the Earth's atmosphere, including the process of mapping locations and properties of the matter and radiation in the universe.

athlete.meanings: A participant in a group of sporting activities which includes track and field, road running, cross country running and racewalking.

atmosphere.meanings: The gases surrounding the Earth or any astronomical body.

atrium.meanings: A central room or space in ancient Roman homes, open to the sky in the middle; a similar space in other buildings.

attach.meanings: To fasten, to join to (literally and figuratively).

attack.meanings: An attempt to cause damage, injury to, or death of opponent or enemy.

attainment.meanings: The act of attaining; the act of arriving at or reaching; the act of obtaining by exertion or effort.

attempt.meanings: The action of trying at something.

attend.meanings: To listen to (something or someone); to pay attention to; regard; heed.

attendant.meanings: One who attends; one who works with or watches over something.

attentive.meanings: Paying attention; noticing, watching, listening, or attending closely.

attic.meanings: The space, often unfinished and with sloped walls, directly below the roof in the uppermost part of a house or other building, generally used for storage or habitation.

attire.meanings: (clothing) One's dress; what one wears; one's clothes.

attitude.meanings: The position of the body or way of carrying oneself.

attorney.meanings: A lawyer; one who advises or represents others in legal matters as a profession.

attractive.meanings: Causing attraction; having the quality of attracting by inherent force.

auction.meanings: A public event where goods or property are sold to the highest bidder.

auctioneer.meanings: A person who conducts an auction on behalf of a vendor, taking bids to find the best price for the vendor.

audience.meanings: A group of people within hearing; specifically, a large gathering of people listening to or watching a performance, speech, etc.

audio-visual.meanings: Containing both aural and visual elements.

audio.meanings: A sound, or a sound signal

audiovisual.meanings: Containing both aural and visual elements.

audit.definition: 審計,查帳,決算,審核,查帳

auditorium.meanings: A large room for public meetings or performances.

aunt.meanings: The sister or sister-in-law of one’s parent.

authentic.meanings: Of the same origin as claimed; genuine.

author.meanings: The originator or creator of a work, especially of a literary composition.

authority.meanings: The power to enforce rules or give orders.

autobiography.meanings: A self-written biography; the story of one's own life.

autographed.meanings: To sign, or write one’s name or signature on a book etc

automobile.meanings: A type of vehicle designed to move on the ground under its own stored power and intended to carry a driver, a small number of additional passengers, and a very limited amount of other load. A car or motorcar.

autonomy.meanings: Self-government; freedom to act or function independently.

autumn.meanings: Traditionally the third of the four seasons, when deciduous trees lose their leaves; typically regarded as being from September 24 to December 22 in parts of the Northern Hemisphere, and the months of March, April and May in the Southern Hemisphere.

available.meanings: Such as one may avail oneself of; capable of being used for the accomplishment of a purpose.

avenge.meanings: An act of vengeance; a revenge.

avenue.meanings: A broad street, especially one bordered by trees.

aviation.meanings: The art or science of making and flying aircraft.

avoid.meanings: To try not to meet or communicate with (a person); to shun

awaken.meanings: To become conscious after having slept.

awaking.meanings: To become conscious after having slept.

award.meanings: A judgment, sentence, or final decision. Specifically: The decision of arbitrators in a case submitted.

away.meanings: To depart; to go to another place.

awkward.meanings: Someone or something that is awkward.

awkwardly.meanings: In an awkward manner; with discomfort or lack of coordination.

awkwardness.meanings: The state or quality of being awkward; clumsiness; unskillfulness.

ax.meanings: A tool for felling trees or chopping wood etc. consisting of a heavy head flattened to a blade on one side, and a handle attached to it.

baby-sitter.meanings: A person who cares for one or more babies or children for a short period of time in place of their legal guardians.

baby.meanings: A very young human, particularly from birth to a couple of years old or until walking is fully mastered.

babysit.meanings: To watch or tend someone else's child for a period of time, often for money.

bachelor party.meanings: A party held for a man who is about to be married, normally attended only by male friends and relatives.

bachelor.meanings: A person, especially a man, who is socially regarded as able to marry, but has not yet.

back up.meanings: To move backwards, especially for a vehicle to do so.

back.meanings: The rear of the body, especially the part between the neck and the end of the spine and opposite the chest and belly.

background radiation.meanings: Ionizing radiation that is naturally present in the environment.

background.meanings: One's social heritage, or previous life; what one did in the past.

backpack.meanings: A knapsack, sometimes mounted on a light frame, but always supported by straps, worn on a person’s back for the purpose of carrying things, especially when hiking, or on a student's back when carrying books.

backstroke.meanings: A swimming stroke swum lying on one's back, while rotating both arms through the water as to propel the swimmer backwards.

bacon.meanings: Cured meat from the sides, belly or back of a pig.

bacteria.meanings: A type, species, or strain of bacterium.

badge.meanings: A distinctive mark, token, sign, emblem or cognizance, worn on one's clothing, as an insignia of some rank, or of the membership of an organization.

badminton.meanings: A racquet sport played indoors on a court by two opposing players (singles) or two opposing pairs of players (doubles), in which a shuttlecock is volleyed over a net and the competitions are presided by an umpire in British English and a referee in American English.

bag.meanings: A flexible container made of cloth, paper, plastic, etc.

bail.meanings: Security, usually a sum of money, exchanged for the release of an arrested person as a guarantee of that person's appearance for trial.

bait.meanings: Any substance, especially food, used in catching fish, or other animals, by alluring them to a hook, snare, trap, or net.

bake.meanings: The act of cooking food by baking.

bakery.meanings: A shop in which bread (and often other baked goods such as cakes) is baked and/or sold.

balance.meanings: A state in which opposing forces harmonise; equilibrium.
balance.definition: 結存,結餘,結算,始收支帄衡

balcony.meanings: An accessible structure extending from a building, especially outside a window.

bald.meanings: A mountain summit or crest that lacks forest growth despite a warm climate conducive to such, as is found in many places in the Southern Appalachian Mountains.

bale.meanings: Evil, especially considered as an active force for destruction or death.

balk.meanings: An uncultivated ridge formed in the open field system, caused by the action of ploughing.

ball.meanings: A solid or hollow sphere, or roughly spherical mass.

ballad.meanings: A kind of narrative poem, adapted for recitation or singing; especially, a sentimental or romantic poem in short stanzas.

balloon.meanings: An inflatable buoyant object, often (but not necessarily) round and flexible.

ballot.meanings: Originally, a small ball placed in a container to cast a vote; now, by extension, a piece of paper or card used for this purpose, or some other means used to signify a vote.

ballroom.meanings: A large room used for dancing and banquets.

bam.meanings: Representing a loud noise or heavy impact.

bamboo.meanings: A grass of the Poaceae family, characterised by its woody, hollow, round, straight, jointed stem, all of which are in the Bambuseae tribe.

banana.meanings: An elongated curved tropical fruit that grows in bunches and has a creamy flesh and a smooth skin.

band.meanings: A strip of material used for strengthening or coupling.

bandage.meanings: A strip of gauze or similar material used to protect or support a wound or injury.

bank statement.meanings: A communication from a bank to a person holding an account in that bank, usually issued monthly, detailing the value of the holdings in that account and the effects of all transactions occurring with respect to that account.

bank.meanings: An institution where one can place and borrow money and take care of financial affairs.

banker.meanings: One who conducts the business of banking; one who, individually, or as a member of a company, keeps an establishment for the deposit or loan of money, or for traffic in money, bills of exchange, etc.

bankroll.meanings: A roll of banknotes or other paper currency, carried in lieu of a wallet.
bankroll.definition: 鈔票,資金,提供資金,提供財務上的協助

bankrupt.meanings: One who becomes unable to pay his or her debts; an insolvent person.

bankruptcy.meanings: A legally declared or recognized condition of insolvency of a person or organization.

banquet.meanings: A large celebratory meal; a feast.

baptism.meanings: A Christian sacrament, by which one is received into a church and sometimes given a name, generally involving the candidate to be anointed with or submerged in water.

bar.meanings: A solid, more or less rigid object of metal or wood with a uniform cross-section smaller than its length.

barbecue.meanings: A fireplace or pit for grilling food, typically used outdoors and traditionally employing hot charcoal as the heating medium.

barber.meanings: A person whose profession is cutting (usually male) customers' hair and beards.

bargain.meanings: An agreement between parties concerning the sale of property; or a contract by which one party binds himself to transfer the right to some property for a consideration, and the other party binds himself to receive the property and pay the consideration.
bargain.definition: 討價商品,便宜貨,討價還價,達成協議,交易,特價商品

bargaining.meanings: To make a bargain; to make a deal or contract for the exchange of property or services; to negotiate

bark.meanings: The short, loud, explosive sound uttered by a dog, a fox, and some other animals.

barkeeper.meanings: A bartender: a person preparing and serving drinks at a bar.

barrel.meanings: A round vessel or cask, of greater length than breadth, and bulging in the middle, made of staves bound with hoops, and having flat ends or heads. Sometimes applied to a similar cylindrical container made of metal, usually called a drum.

barring.meanings: To obstruct the passage of (someone or something).

bartender.meanings: One who tends a bar or pub; a person preparing and serving drinks at a bar.

base.meanings: Something from which other things extend; a foundation.

baseball.meanings: A sport common in North America, the Caribbean, and Japan, in which the object is to strike a ball so that one of a nine-person team can run counter-clockwise among four bases, resulting in the scoring of a run. The team with the most runs after termination of play, usually nine innings, wins.

based.meanings: To give as its foundation or starting point; to lay the foundation of.

basement.meanings: A floor of a building below ground level.

baseness.meanings: The quality or condition of being base.

basic.meanings: A necessary commodity, a staple requirement.

basin.meanings: A wide bowl for washing, sometimes affixed to a wall

basket.meanings: A lightweight container, generally round, open at the top, and tapering toward the bottom.

basketball.meanings: A sport in which two opposing teams of five players strive to put a ball through a hoop.

bass.meanings: A low spectrum of sound tones.

bastard.meanings: A person who was born out of wedlock, and hence often considered an illegitimate descendant.

bat.meanings: Any of the flying mammals of the order Chiroptera, usually small and nocturnal, insectivorous or frugivorous.

batch.meanings: The quantity of bread or other baked goods baked at one time.

bath.meanings: A tub or pool which is used for bathing: bathtub.

bathe.meanings: The act of swimming or bathing, especially in the sea, a lake, or a river; a swimming bath.

bathroom.meanings: A room containing a shower and/or bathtub, and (typically but not necessarily) a toilet.

bathtub.meanings: A large container for holding water in which a person may bathe (take a bath).

batter.meanings: To hit or strike violently and repeatedly.

battery.meanings: A device used to power electric devices, consisting of a set of electrically connected electrochemical or, archaically, electrostatic cells. A single such cell when used by itself.

battlefield.meanings: The area where a land battle is or was fought, which is not necessarily a field.

beach.meanings: The shore of a body of water, especially when sandy or pebbly.

beam.meanings: Any large piece of timber or iron long in proportion to its thickness, and prepared for use.

bean.meanings: A reusable software component written in Java.

bear.meanings: A large omnivorous mammal, related to the dog and raccoon, having shaggy hair, a very small tail, and flat feet; a member of family Ursidae.

beard.meanings: Facial hair on the chin, cheeks, jaw and neck.

beast.meanings: Any animal other than a human; usually only applied to land vertebrates, especially large or dangerous four-footed ones.

beautiful.meanings: Someone who is beautiful. Can be used as a term of address.

beautify.meanings: To make beautiful, or to increase the beauty of.

beauty.meanings: The quality of being (especially visually) attractive, pleasing, fine or good-looking; comeliness.

beckon.meanings: A sign made without words; a beck.

bed.meanings: A piece of furniture, usually flat and soft, on which to rest or sleep.

bedding.meanings: The textiles associated with a bed, e.g., sheets, pillowcases, bedspreads, blankets, etc.

bedroom.meanings: A room in a house where a bed is kept for sleeping.

bee.meanings: A flying insect, of the clade Anthophila within the hymenopteran superfamily Apoidea, known for its organised societies (though only a minority have them), for collecting pollen and (in some species) producing wax and honey.

beef.meanings: The meat from a cow, bull or other bovine.

beer.meanings: An alcoholic drink fermented from starch material, commonly barley malt, often with hops or some other substance to impart a bitter flavor.

beforehand.meanings: In comfortable circumstances as regards property; forehanded.

beg.meanings: The act of begging; an imploring request.

beginner.meanings: Someone who is just starting at something, or has only recently started.

behave.meanings: To conduct (oneself) well, or in a given way.

behavior.meanings: Human conduct relative to social norms.

behold.meanings: To see or look at, esp. appreciatively; to descry, look upon.

belief.meanings: Mental acceptance of a claim as true.

believe.meanings: To accept as true, particularly without absolute certainty (i.e., as opposed to knowing)

bell.meanings: A percussive instrument made of metal or other hard material, typically but not always in the shape of an inverted cup with a flared rim, which resonates when struck.

belligerent.meanings: A state or other armed participant in warfare

belly.meanings: The abdomen, especially a fat one.

belt.meanings: A band worn around the waist to hold clothing to one's body (usually pants), hold weapons (such as a gun or sword), or serve as a decorative piece of clothing.

bench.meanings: A long seat with or without a back, found for example in parks and schools.

benchmark.meanings: A standard by which something is evaluated or measured.

benefactor.meanings: Somebody who gives a gift, often money to a charity.

beneficent.meanings: Given to acts that are kind, charitable, philanthropic or beneficial.

beneficiary.meanings: One who benefits or receives an advantage.

benefit.meanings: An advantage; help or aid from something.

berry.meanings: A small succulent fruit, of any one of many varieties.

besiege.meanings: To beset or surround with armed forces for the purpose of compelling to surrender, to lay siege to, beleaguer.

best.meanings: The supreme effort one can make, or has made.

bestseller.meanings: A book or other product that has sold in large numbers.

bet.meanings: A wager, an agreement between two parties that a stake (usually money) will be paid by the loser to the winner (the winner being the one who correctly forecast the outcome of an event).

better.meanings: An entity, usually animate, deemed superior to another; one who has a claim to precedence; a superior.

between.meanings: A kind of needle, shorter than a sharp, with a small rounded eye, used for making fine stitches on heavy fabrics.

beverage.meanings: A liquid to consume; a drink, such as tea, coffee, liquor, beer, milk, juice, or soft drinks, usually excluding water.

beware.meanings: (defective) To use caution, pay attention to (used both with and without of).

bewilder.meanings: To confuse, disorientate, or puzzle someone, especially with many different choices.

bias.meanings: Inclination towards something; predisposition, partiality, prejudice, preference, predilection.

biblical.meanings: Of or relating to the Bible.

bicycle.meanings: A vehicle that has two wheels, one behind the other, a steering handle, and a saddle seat or seats and is usually propelled by the action of a rider’s feet upon pedals.

bid.meanings: To issue a command; to tell.

biennial.meanings: A plant that requires two years to complete its life-cycle, germinating and growing in its first year, then producing its flowers and fruit in its second year, after which it usually dies

big.meanings: Someone or something that is large in stature

bikini.meanings: A brief two-piece bathing suit worn by women, especially one that exposes the midriff and navel.

bill.meanings: Any of various bladed or pointed hand weapons, originally designating an Anglo-Saxon sword, and later a weapon of infantry, especially in the 14th and 15th centuries, commonly consisting of a broad, heavy, double-edged, hook-shaped blade, with a short pike at the back and another at the top, attached to the end of a long staff.

billion.meanings: (modern British & Australian, short scale) a thousand million (logic: 1,000 × 1,000^2): 1 followed by nine zeros, 109; a milliard

billionaire.meanings: Somebody whose wealth is greater than one billion (109) dollars, or other currency.

bimonthly.meanings: A publication that is published on a bimonthly basis.
bimonthly.definition: 兩月一次的,一月兩次的

bingo.meanings: A game of chance for two or more players, who mark off numbers on a grid as they are announced by the caller; the game is won by the first person to call out "bingo!" or "house!" after crossing off all numbers on the grid or in one line of the grid.

biochemistry.meanings: The chemistry of those compounds that occur in living organisms, and the processes that occur in their metabolism and catabolism

biodegradable.meanings: Any material that can be decomposed by biological activity.

biography.meanings: A person's life story, especially one published.

biology.meanings: The study of all life or living matter.

biotechnology.meanings: The use of living organisms (especially microorganisms) in industrial, agricultural, medical and other technological applications.

bird.meanings: A member of the class of animals Aves in the phylum Chordata, characterized by being warm-blooded, having feathers and wings usually capable of flight, and laying eggs.

birth.meanings: The process of childbearing; the beginning of life.

biscuit.meanings: (rare in the US) A small, flat, baked good which is either hard and crisp or else soft but firm: a cookie.

bishop.meanings: An overseer of congregations: either any such overseer, generally speaking, or (in Eastern Orthodoxy, Catholicism, Anglicanism, etc.) an official in the church hierarchy (actively or nominally) governing a diocese, supervising the church's priests, deacons, and property in its territory.

bisque.meanings: A thick creamy soup made from fish, shellfish, meat or vegetables.

bitter.meanings: (usually in the plural bitters) A liquid or powder, made from bitter herbs, used in mixed drinks or as a tonic.

bitterness.meanings: The quality of having a bitter taste.

biweekly.meanings: Something that is published or released once every two weeks.

bizarre.meanings: Strangely unconventional in style or appearance.

black.meanings: The colour/color perceived in the absence of light, but also when no light is reflected, but rather absorbed.

blackboard.meanings: A large flat surface, finished with black slate or a similar material, that can be written upon with chalk and subsequently erased; a chalkboard.

bland.meanings: Having a soothing effect; not irritating or stimulating.

blank.meanings: A small French coin, originally of silver, afterwards of copper, worth 5 deniers; also a silver coin of Henry V current in the parts of France then held by the English, worth about 8 pence .

blanket.meanings: A heavy, loosely woven fabric, usually large and woollen, used for warmth while sleeping or resting.

blaze.meanings: A fire, especially a fast-burning fire producing a lot of flames and light.

bleed.meanings: An incident of bleeding, as in haemophilia.

blemish.meanings: A small flaw which spoils the appearance of something, a stain, a spot.

blend.meanings: A mixture of two or more things.

bless.meanings: To make something holy by religious rite, sanctify.

blessing.meanings: To make something holy by religious rite, sanctify.

blind.meanings: A covering for a window to keep out light. The covering may be made of cloth or of narrow slats that can block light or allow it to pass.

blink.meanings: The act of very quickly closing both eyes and opening them again.

bloc.meanings: A group of voters or politicians who share common goals.

block.meanings: A substantial, often approximately cuboid, piece of any substance.

blockbuster.meanings: A high-explosive bomb used for the purposes of demolishing extensive areas, such as a city block.

blonde.meanings: A pale yellowish (golden brown) color, especially said of hair color.

blood.meanings: A member of the Los Angeles gang The Bloods.

bloody.meanings: To draw blood from one's opponent in a fight.

bloom.meanings: A blossom; the flower of a plant; an expanded bud.

blossom.meanings: A flower, especially one indicating that a fruit tree is fruiting; a mass of such flowers.

blue.meanings: The colour of the clear sky or the deep sea, between green and violet in the visible spectrum, and one of the primary additive colours for transmitted light; the colour obtained by subtracting red and green from white light using magenta and cyan filters; or any colour resembling this.

blueprint.meanings: A type of paper-based reproduction process producing white-on-blue images, used primarily for technical and architecture's drawings, now largely replaced by other technologies.

blues.meanings: The colour of the clear sky or the deep sea, between green and violet in the visible spectrum, and one of the primary additive colours for transmitted light; the colour obtained by subtracting red and green from white light using magenta and cyan filters; or any colour resembling this.

bluff.meanings: An act of bluffing; a false expression of the strength of one's position in order to intimidate; braggadocio.

blush.meanings: An act of blushing; a red glow on the face caused by shame, modesty, etc.

board.meanings: A relatively long, wide and thin piece of any material, usually wood or similar, often for use in construction or furniture-making.

boast.meanings: A brag; ostentatious positive appraisal of oneself.

boat.meanings: A craft used for transportation of goods, fishing, racing, recreational cruising, or military use on or in the water, propelled by oars or outboard motor or inboard motor or by wind.

bodily.meanings: Of, relating to, or concerning the body.

bodyguard.meanings: A person or group of persons, often armed, responsible for protecting an individual.

boil.meanings: A localized accumulation of pus in the skin, resulting from infection.

boldly.meanings: In a bold manner; with confidence.

bolt.meanings: A (usually) metal fastener consisting of a cylindrical body that is threaded, with a larger head on one end. It can be inserted into an unthreaded hole up to the head, with a nut then threaded on the other end; a heavy machine screw.

bomb.meanings: An explosive device used or intended as a weapon.

bond.meanings: Evidence of a long-term debt, by which the bond issuer (the borrower) is obliged to pay interest when due, and repay the principal at maturity, as specified on the face of the bond certificate. The rights of the holder are specified in the bond indenture, which contains the legal terms and conditions under which the bond was issued. Bonds are available in two forms: registered bonds, and bearer bonds.

bone.meanings: A composite material consisting largely of calcium phosphate and collagen and making up the skeleton of most vertebrates.

bonus.meanings: Something extra that is good; an added benefit.

book.meanings: A collection of sheets of paper bound together to hinge at one edge, containing printed or written material, pictures, etc.

bookcase.meanings: A piece of furniture for the storage and display of books.

bookkeeper.meanings: A person responsible for keeping records or documents, such as of a business.

bookstore.meanings: A store where books are bought and sold.

boom.meanings: A low-pitched, resonant sound, such as of an explosion.

boost.meanings: A push from behind, as to one who is endeavoring to climb.

boot.meanings: A heavy shoe that covers part of the leg.

booth.meanings: A small stall for the display and sale of goods.

booties.meanings: A soft, woolen shoe, usually knitted, for a baby or small pet.

couch.meanings: Couch grass, a species of persistent grass, Elymus repens, usually considered a weed.

creativity.meanings: The ability to use imagination to produce a novel idea or product that is useful to society.

currency.meanings: Money or other items used to facilitate transactions.

curriculum.meanings: The set of courses, coursework, and their content, offered at a school or university.

The scale is arbitrarily defined, such as from 1 to 10 by ones, 1 to 100 by 0.1, or simply true or false, on or off, yes, no, or maybe, etc.

devotion.meanings: The act or state of devoting or being devoted.

dignify.meanings: To invest with dignity or honour.

dignitary.meanings: An important or influential person, or one of high rank or position.

dignity.meanings: The state of being dignified or worthy of esteem: elevation of mind or character.

dilemma.meanings: A circumstance in which a choice must be made between two or more alternatives that seem equally undesirable.

diligence.meanings: Steady application; industry; careful work involving long-term effort.

diligent.meanings: Performing with industrious concentration; hard-working and focused.

dilute.meanings: An animal having a lighter-coloured coat than is usual.

dime.meanings: A coin worth one-tenth of a U.S. dollar.

dimension.meanings: A single aspect of a given thing.

diminutive.meanings: (grammar) A word form expressing smallness, youth, unimportance, or endearment.

dinner.meanings: A midday meal (in a context in which the evening meal is called supper or tea).

dinosaur.meanings: In scientific usage, any of the animals belonging to the clade Dinosauria, especially those that existed during the Triassic, Jurassic and Cretaceous periods and are now extinct.

dip.meanings: A lower section of a road or geological feature.

diploma.meanings: A document issued by an educational institution testifying that the recipient has earned a degree or has successfully completed a particular course of study.

diplomacy.meanings: The art and practice of conducting international relations by negotiating alliances, treaties, agreements etc., bilaterally or multilaterally, between states and sometimes international organizations, or even between polities with varying status, such as those of monarchs and their princely vassals.

diplomat.meanings: A person, such as an ambassador, who is accredited to represent a government officially in its relations with other governments or international organisations

dire.meanings: Warning of bad consequences: ill-boding; portentous.

direction.meanings: A theoretical line (physically or mentally) followed from a point of origin or towards a destination. May be relative (e.g. up, left, outbound, dorsal), geographical (e.g. north), rotational (e.g. clockwise), or with respect to an object or location (e.g. toward Boston).

director.meanings: One who directs; the person in charge of managing a department or directorate (e.g., director of engineering), project, or production (as in a show or film, e.g., film director).

directory.meanings: A list of names, addresses etc, of specific classes of people or organizations, often in alphabetical order or in some classification.

disability.meanings: State of being disabled; deprivation or want of ability; absence of competent physical, intellectual, or moral power, means, fitness, and the like.

disable.meanings: To render unable; to take away an ability of, as by crippling.

disadvantage.meanings: A weakness or undesirable characteristic; a con.

disagree.meanings: To fail to agree; to have a different opinion or belief.

disappoint.meanings: To sadden or displease (someone) by underperforming, or by not delivering something promised or hoped for.

disapprove.meanings: To condemn; to consider wrong or inappropriate; used with of.

disarm.meanings: The act of depriving a person of a weapon they carry.

disaster.meanings: An unexpected natural or man-made catastrophe of substantial extent causing significant physical damage or destruction, loss of life or sometimes permanent change to the natural environment.

disastrous.meanings: Of the nature of a disaster; calamitous.

disbelief.meanings: Unpreparedness, unwillingness, or inability to believe that something is the case.

disbelieve.meanings: To not believe; to exercise disbelief.

disc.meanings: A thin, flat, circular plate or similar object.

discern.meanings: To detect with the senses, especially with the eyes.

discernible.meanings: Possible to discern; detectable or derivable by use of the senses or the intellect.

discharge.meanings: Pus or exudate (other than blood) from a wound or orifice, usually due to infection or pathology.

disciple.meanings: A person who learns from another, especially one who then teaches others.

disco.meanings: A genre of dance music that was popular in the 1970s, characterized by elements of soul music with a strong Latin-American beat and often accompanied by pulsating lights.

discoloration.meanings: The act of discoloring, or the state of being discolored; alteration of hue or appearance.

disconnect.meanings: A break or interruption in an existing connection, continuum, or process; disconnection.

discouraging.meanings: To extinguish the courage of; to dishearten; to depress the spirits of; to deprive of confidence; to deject.

discover.meanings: To find or learn something for the first time.

discreet.meanings: Respectful of privacy or secrecy; exercising caution in order to avoid causing embarrassment; quiet; diplomatic.

discrepancy.meanings: An inconsistency between facts or sentiments.
discrepancy.definition: 差異,不和諧,不同之處,不一致、差異

discretion.meanings: The quality of being discreet or circumspect.

discrimination.meanings: Discernment, the act of discriminating, discerning, distinguishing, noting or perceiving differences between things, with intent to understand rightly and make correct decisions.

discuss.meanings: To converse or debate concerning a particular topic.

discussion.meanings: Conversation or debate concerning a particular topic.

disdain.meanings: A feeling of contempt or scorn.

disease.meanings: An abnormal condition of a human, animal or plant that causes discomfort or dysfunction; distinct from injury insofar as the latter is usually instantaneously acquired.

disembark.meanings: To remove from on board a vessel; to put on shore

disgruntle.meanings: To make discontent or cross; to put in a bad temper.

disguise.meanings: Material (such as clothing, makeup, a wig) used to alter one’s visual appearance in order to hide one's identity or assume another.

disgust.meanings: An intense dislike or loathing someone feels for something bad or nasty.

disgusting.meanings: To cause an intense dislike for something.

dish.meanings: A vessel such as a plate for holding or serving food, often flat with a depressed region in the middle.

dishearten.meanings: To discourage someone by removing their enthusiasm or courage.

disinclination.meanings: The state of being disinclined; want of propensity, desire, or affection; slight aversion or dislike

disinterested.meanings: Having no stake or interest in the outcome; free of bias, impartial.

disk.meanings: A thin, flat, circular plate or similar object.

dislodge.meanings: To remove or force out from a position or dwelling previously occupied.

dismantle.meanings: To divest, strip of dress or covering.

dismay.meanings: A sudden or complete loss of courage and firmness in the face of trouble or danger; overwhelming and disabling terror; a sinking of the spirits

dismiss.meanings: To discharge; to end the employment or service of.

dismissal.meanings: The act of sending someone away.

dismissed.meanings: To discharge; to end the employment or service of.

disorder.meanings: Absence of order; state of not being arranged in an orderly manner.

disorganized.meanings: To make less organized; to reduce to chaos.

dispatch.meanings: A message sent quickly, as a shipment, a prompt settlement of a business, or an important official message sent by a diplomat, or military officer.

dispel.meanings: An act or instance of dispelling.

dispensable.meanings: Able to be done without; able to be expended; easily replaced.

displace.meanings: To put out of place; to disarrange.

displacement.meanings: The act of displacing, or the state of being displaced; a putting out of place.

displease.meanings: To make not pleased; to cause a feeling of disapprobation or dislike in; to be disagreeable to; to vex slightly.

disposable.meanings: Any object that is designed to be disposed of rather than refilled or repaired.

disposal.meanings: An arrangement, categorization or classification of things.

dispose.meanings: The disposal or management of something.

disposition.meanings: The arrangement or placement of certain things.

dispute.meanings: An argument or disagreement, a failure to agree.

disputed.meanings: To contend in argument; to argue against something maintained, upheld, or claimed, by another

disregard.meanings: The act or state of deliberately not paying attention or caring about; misregard.

disrupt.meanings: To throw into confusion or disorder.

disruption.meanings: An interruption to the regular flow or sequence of something.

dissatisfy.meanings: To fail to satisfy; to displease.

disseminate.meanings: To sow and scatter principles, ideas, opinions, etc, or concrete things, for growth and propagation, like seeds.

dissident.meanings: A person who formally opposes the current political structure, the political group in power, the policies of the political group in power, or current laws.

dissuade.meanings: To convince not to try or do.

distance.meanings: The amount of space between two points, usually geographical points, usually (but not necessarily) measured along a straight line.

distinct.meanings: Capable of being perceived very clearly.

distinction.meanings: That which distinguishes; a single occurrence of a determining factor or feature, the fact of being divided; separation, discrimination.

distinctive.meanings: A distinctive thing: a quality or property permitting distinguishing; a characteristic.

distinctively.meanings: In a distinctive manner; in a way that is notable for its difference.

distinguish.meanings: To recognize someone or something as different from others based on its characteristics.

distinguished.meanings: To recognize someone or something as different from others based on its characteristics.

distort.meanings: To bring something out of shape, to misshape.

distorted.meanings: To bring something out of shape, to misshape.

distribute.meanings: To divide into portions and dispense.

distribution.meanings: An act of distributing or state of being distributed.

district.meanings: An administrative division of an area.

distrustful.meanings: (active sense) Experiencing distrust, showing distrust, wary, sceptical, suspicious, doubtful.

disturbing.meanings: To confuse a quiet, constant state or a calm, continuous flow, in particular: thoughts, actions or liquids.

ditch.meanings: A trench; a long, shallow indentation, as for irrigation or drainage.

dive.meanings: A jump or plunge into water.

diverge.meanings: (of lines or paths) To run apart; to separate; to tend into different directions.

diverged.meanings: (of lines or paths) To run apart; to separate; to tend into different directions.

diverse.meanings: Consisting of many different elements; various.

diversify.meanings: To make diverse or various in form or quality; to give variety to distinguish by numerous differences or aspects.

diversion.meanings: A tactic used to draw attention away from the real threat or action.

diversity.meanings: The quality of being diverse or different; difference or unlikeness.

divert.meanings: To turn aside from a course.

dividend.meanings: A number or expression that is to be divided by another.

divine.meanings: One skilled in divinity; a theologian.

division.meanings: The act or process of dividing anything.

divorce.meanings: The legal dissolution of a marriage.

divulge.meanings: To make public or known; to communicate to the public; to tell (information, especially a secret) so that it may become generally known

docent.meanings: A teacher or lecturer at some universities (in central Europe, etc.)

dock.meanings: Any of the genus Rumex of coarse weedy plants with small green flowers related to buckwheat, especially common dock, and used as potherbs and in folk medicine, especially in curing nettle rash.

doctor.meanings: A physician; a member of the medical profession; one who is trained and licensed to heal the sick or injured. The final examination and qualification may award a doctor degree in which case the post-nominal letters are D.O., DPM, M.D., DMD, DDS, in the US or MBBS in the UK.

doctorate.meanings: The highest degree awarded by a university faculty.

document.meanings: An original or official paper used as the basis, proof, or support of anything else, including any writing, book, or other instrument conveying information pertinent to such proof or support.

documentary.meanings: A film, TV program, publication etc. which presents a social, political, scientific or historical subject in a factual or informative manner.

dog.meanings: A mammal, Canis familiaris or Canis lupus familiaris, that has been domesticated for thousands of years, of highly variable appearance due to human breeding.

dogmatic.meanings: One of an ancient sect of physicians who went by general principles; opposed to the empiric.

dole.meanings: Money or other goods given as charity.

doll.meanings: A toy in the form of a human.

dollar.meanings: Official designation for currency in some parts of the world, including Canada, the United States, Australia, New Zealand, Hong Kong, and elsewhere. Its symbol is $.

dolphin.meanings: A carnivorous aquatic mammal in one of several families of order Cetacea, famed for its intelligence and occasional willingness to approach humans.

domain.meanings: A geographic area owned or controlled by a single person or organization.

domestic.meanings: A house servant; a maid; a household worker.

dominant.meanings: The fifth major tone of a musical scale (five major steps above the note in question); thus G is the dominant of C, A of D, and so on.

donate.meanings: To make a donation; to give away something of value to support or contribute towards a cause or for the benefit of another.

donation.meanings: A voluntary gift or contribution for a specific cause.

donkey.meanings: A domestic animal, Equus asinus asinus, similar to a horse

doom.definition: 死亡,毀滅,厄運,使註定,使必然發生

doomed.meanings: To pronounce sentence or judgment on; to condemn.

doomsday.meanings: The day when God is expected to judge the world; end times.

doorway.meanings: The passage of a door; a door-shaped entrance into a house or a room.

dormitory.meanings: A room containing a number of beds (and often some other furniture and/or utilities) for sleeping, often applied to student and backpacker accommodation of this kind.

dosage.meanings: The administration of a medication etc, in a measured amount; dosing.

double.meanings: Twice the number, amount, size, etc.

doubt.meanings: Disbelief or uncertainty (about something); a particular instance of such disbelief or uncertainty.

doubtless.meanings: Characterized by or experiencing no doubt at all, certain; undoubted; undoubting.

dough.meanings: A thick, malleable substance made by mixing flour with other ingredients such as water, eggs, and/or butter, that is made into a particular form and then baked.

doughnut.meanings: A deep-fried piece of dough or batter, commonly of a toroidal (a ring doughnut) shape, often mixed with various sweeteners and flavourings; or flattened sphere (a filled doughnut) shape filled with jam, custard or cream.

dove.meanings: A pigeon, especially one smaller in size; a bird (often arbitrarily called either a pigeon or a dove or both) of more than 300 species of the family Columbidae.

down payment.meanings: A payment representing a fraction of the price of something being purchased, made to secure the right to continue making payments towards that purchase.

downsize.meanings: To reduce in size or number.

downstairs.meanings: The lower floor of a house, at ground level.

downtime.meanings: The amount of time lost due to forces beyond one's control, as with a computer crash.

downtown.meanings: The main business part of a city or town, usually located at or near its center.

downturn.meanings: A downward trend, or the beginnings of one; a decline.

downwards.meanings: Towards a lower place; towards what is below.

doze.meanings: A light, short sleep or nap.

draft.meanings: A current of air, usually coming into a room or vehicle.

drafting.meanings: To write a first version, make a preliminary sketch.

drag.meanings: Resistance of the air (or some other fluid) to something moving through it.

dragon.meanings: A legendary serpentine or reptilian creature.

dragonfly.meanings: An insect of the suborder Epiprocta or, more strictly, the infraorder Anisoptera, having four long transparent wings held perpendicular to a long body when perched.

drain.meanings: A conduit allowing liquid to flow out of an otherwise contained volume; a plughole (UK)

drainage.meanings: A natural or artificial removal of fluid from a given area by its draining away.

drama.meanings: A composition, normally in prose, telling a story and intended to be represented by actors impersonating the characters and speaking the dialogue

dramatic.meanings: Of or relating to the drama.

draught.meanings: A current of air, usually coming into a room or vehicle.

draw.meanings: The result of a contest that neither side has won; a tie.

drawback.meanings: A disadvantage; something that detracts or takes away.

drawer.meanings: An open-topped box that can be slid in and out of the cabinet that contains it, used for storing clothing or other articles.

dread.meanings: Great fear in view of impending evil; fearful apprehension of danger; anticipatory terror.

dreadful.meanings: A shocker: a report of a crime written in a provokingly lurid style.

dream.meanings: Imaginary events seen in the mind while sleeping.

drench.meanings: A draught administered to an animal.

dress.meanings: An item of clothing (usually worn by a woman or young girl) which both covers the upper part of the body and includes skirts below the waist.

drift.meanings: (physical) Movement; that which moves or is moved.

drill.meanings: A tool used to remove material so as to create a hole, typically by plunging a rotating cutting bit into a stationary workpiece.

drink.meanings: To consume (a liquid) through the mouth.

drive.meanings: Motivation to do or achieve something; ability coupled with ambition.

driven.meanings: To provide an impetus for motion or other physical change, to move an object by means of the provision of force thereto.

driveway.meanings: Short private road that leads to a house or garage.

drop.meanings: A small quantity of liquid, just large enough to hold its own round shape via surface tension, especially one that falls from a source of liquid.

dropout.meanings: Someone who has left an educational institution without completing the course

drought.meanings: A period of unusually low rainfall, longer and more severe than a dry spell.

drown.meanings: To die from suffocation while immersed in water or other fluid.

drowsy.meanings: Inclined to drowse; heavy with sleepiness

drug.meanings: A substance used to treat an illness, relieve a symptom, or modify a chemical process in the body for a specific purpose.

drugstore.meanings: A pharmacy; a retail store, the main product of which is medications (usually both prescription and non-prescription), along with first aid and other similar products.

drum.meanings: A percussive musical instrument spanned with a thin covering on at least one end for striking, forming an acoustic chamber, affecting what materials are used to make it; a membranophone.

drunk.meanings: To consume (a liquid) through the mouth.

drunkard.meanings: (somewhat derogatory) A person who is habitually drunk.

dry up.meanings: To become dry (often of weather); to lose water.

dry.meanings: The process by which something is dried.

dryer.meanings: One who, or that which, dries; a desiccative.

dual.meanings: Of an item that is one of a pair, the other item in the pair.

dubious.meanings: (of a statement) Arousing doubt; questionable; open to suspicion.

duck.meanings: To quickly lower the head or body in order to prevent it from being struck by something.

due to.meanings: Caused by; resulting from; because of.

duke.meanings: The male ruler of a duchy (female equivalent: duchess).

dull.meanings: To render dull; to remove or blunt an edge or something that was sharp.

dumb.meanings: Unable to speak; lacking power of speech (kept in "deaf, dumb, and blind").

dump.meanings: A place where waste or garbage is left; a ground or place for dumping ashes, refuse, etc.; a disposal site.

duplicate.meanings: One that resembles or corresponds to another; an identical copy.

durable.meanings: A durable thing, one useful over more than one period, especially a year.

duration.meanings: An amount of time or a particular time interval.

dutiful.meanings: Accepting of one's legal or moral obligations and willing to do them well, and without complaint.

duty.meanings: That which one is morally or legally obligated to do.

dwarf.meanings: Any member of a race of beings from (especially Scandinavian and other Germanic) folklore, usually depicted as having some sort of supernatural powers and being skilled in crafting and metalworking, often as short with long beards, and sometimes as clashing with elves.

dweller.meanings: An inhabitant of a specific place; an inhabitant or denizen.

dye.meanings: A colourant, especially one that has an affinity to the substrate to which it is applied.

dynamic.meanings: A characteristic or manner of an interaction; a behavior.

dynamite.meanings: A class of explosives made from nitroglycerine in an absorbent medium such as kieselguhr, used in mining and blasting; invented by Alfred Nobel in 1867.

dynasty.meanings: A series of rulers or dynasts from one family.

dysfunctional.meanings: Not performing its proper or intended function.

e-mail.meanings: A system for transferring messages from one computer to another, usually through a network.

each.meanings: (operations) An individual item: the least quantitative unit in a grouping.

eagerness.meanings: The state or quality of being eager; ardent desire.

eagle.meanings: Any of several large carnivorous and carrion-eating birds in the family Accipitridae, having a powerful hooked bill and keen vision.

ear.meanings: The organ of hearing, consisting of the pinna, auditory canal, eardrum, malleus, incus, stapes and cochlea.

early.meanings: A shift (scheduled work period) that takes place early in the day.

earmark.meanings: A mark or deformation of the ear of an animal, intended to indicate ownership.

earn.meanings: To gain (success, reward, recognition) through applied effort or work.

earplug.meanings: A piece of protective gear meant to be inserted in the ear canal to protect the wearer's hearing from loud noises or the intrusion of water.

earth.meanings: The third planet of the Solar System; the world upon which humans live.

earthquake.meanings: A shaking of the ground, caused by volcanic activity or movement around geologic faults.

earthworm.meanings: A worm that lives in the ground.

ease.meanings: Ability, the means to do something, particularly:

east.meanings: One of the four principal compass points, specifically 90°, conventionally directed to the right on maps; the direction of the rising sun at an equinox. Abbreviated as E.

eat.meanings: Something to be eaten; a meal; a food item.

eatery.meanings: A restaurant or café; a place to purchase and eat food.

eavesdrop.meanings: The dripping of rain from the eaves of a house

eccentric.meanings: One who does not behave like others.

echo.meanings: A reflected sound that is heard again by its initial observer.

eclipse.meanings: An alignment of astronomical objects whereby one object comes between the observer (or notional observer) and another object, thus obscuring the latter.

ecology.meanings: The branch of biology dealing with the relationships of organisms with their environment and with each other.

economical.meanings: Careful with money so as not to spend too much; prudent; thrifty.

economically.meanings: (manner) In an economical manner; not wastefully; not extravagantly

economics.meanings: The study of resource allocation, distribution and consumption; of capital and investment; and of management of the factors of production.

economist.meanings: An expert in economics, especially one who studies economic data and extracts higher-level information or proposes theories.

economy.meanings: Effective management of a community or system, or especially its resources.

ecosystem.meanings: A system formed by an ecological community and its environment that functions as a unit.

edge out.meanings: To defeat in a contest or a game by a narrow margin of victory.

edge.meanings: The boundary line of a surface.

edit.meanings: A change to the text of a document.

edition.meanings: A written work edited and published, as by a certain editor or in a certain manner.

editorial.meanings: An article in a publication giving the opinion of its editors on a given topic or current event.

education.meanings: The process of imparting knowledge, skill and judgment.

educational.meanings: A free (or low cost) trip for travel consultants, provided by a travel operator or airline as a means of promoting their service. A fam trip

educator.meanings: A person distinguished for his/her educational work, a teacher.

eel.meanings: Any freshwater or marine fish of the order Anguilliformes, which are elongated and resemble snakes.

effect.meanings: The result or outcome of a cause.

effectively.meanings: In an efficient or effective manner; with powerful effect.

efficacy.meanings: Ability to produce a desired effect under ideal testing conditions.

efficiency.meanings: The extent to which time is well used for the intended task.

efficient.meanings: A cause; something that causes an effect

effort.meanings: The work involved in performing an activity; exertion.

egg.meanings: An approximately spherical or ellipsoidal body produced by birds, reptiles, insects and other animals, housing the embryo during its development.

ego.meanings: The self, especially with a sense of self-importance.

eighteen.meanings: The cardinal number occurring after seventeen and before nineteen, represented in Roman numerals as XVIII and in Arabic numerals as 18.

eighty.meanings: The cardinal number occurring after seventy-nine and before eighty-one, represented in Roman numerals as LXXX and in Arabic numerals as 80.

elaborate.meanings: To develop in detail or complexity

elapsed.meanings: (of time) To pass or move by.

elastic.meanings: An elastic material used in clothing, particularly in waistbands and cuffs.

elbow.meanings: The joint between the upper arm and the forearm.

elder.meanings: An older person or an older member, usually a leader, of some community.

election.meanings: A process of choosing a leader, members of parliament, councillors or other representatives by popular vote.

elective.meanings: Something that is an option or that may be elected, like a course of tertiary study or a medical procedure.

electric.meanings: (usually with definite article) Electricity; the electricity supply.

electrician.meanings: A tradesman who installs, repairs and maintains electrical wiring and equipment.

electricity.meanings: Originally, a property of amber and certain other nonconducting substances to attract lightweight material when rubbed, or the cause of this property; now understood to be a phenomenon caused by the distribution and movement of charged subatomic particles and their interaction with the electromagnetic field.

electronic.meanings: : Of or pertaining to an electron or electrons.

electronics.meanings: The study and use of electrical devices that operate by controlling the flow of electrons or other electrically charged particles or by converting the flow of charged particles to or from other forms of energy.

element.meanings: One of the simplest or essential parts or principles of which anything consists, or upon which the constitution or fundamental powers of anything are based.

elemental.meanings: (theosophy) A creature (usually a spirit) that is attuned with, or composed of, one of the classical elements: air, earth, fire and water or variations of them like ice, lightning, etc. They sometimes have unique proper names and sometimes are referred to as Air, Earth, Fire, or Water.

elephant.meanings: A mammal of the order Proboscidea, having a trunk, and two large ivory tusks jutting from the upper jaw.

elevate.meanings: To raise (something) to a higher position.

elevation.meanings: The act of raising from a lower place, condition, or quality to a higher; said of material things, persons, the mind, the voice, etc.

eleven.meanings: A cricket team of eleven players. Hence first eleven - the team of best cricket players (at a school), second eleven - the "B" team, etc.

eligibility.meanings: The state, quality, or the fact of being eligible.

eligible.definition: 合格的,有資格當選的,法律上合格的

eliminate.meanings: To completely remove, get rid of, put an end to.

elite.meanings: A special group or social class of people which have a superior intellectual, social or economic status as, the elite of society.

elongate.meanings: To make long or longer by pulling and stretching; to make elongated.

else.meanings: (used only with indefinite or interrogative pronouns) Other; in addition to previously mentioned items.

elude.meanings: To evade, or escape from someone or something, especially by using cunning or skill

elusive.definition: 難以描述（或找到、達到、記起）的,困難的,難懂的

emasculate.meanings: To deprive of virile or procreative power; to castrate, to geld.

embargo.meanings: An order by the government prohibiting ships from leaving port.

embark.meanings: To get on a boat or ship or (outside the USA) an aeroplane.

embarrass.meanings: To humiliate; to disrupt somebody's composure or comfort with acting publicly or freely; to disconcert; to abash

embassy.meanings: The function or duty of an ambassador.

embed.meanings: An embedded reporter or journalist, such as a war reporter assigned to and travelling with a military unit, or a political reporter assigned to follow and report on the campaign of a candidate.

embezzle.meanings: To steal or misappropriate money that one has been trusted with, especially to steal money from the organisation for which one works.
embezzle.definition: 貪汙,侵吞,盜用,挪用（錢款）

embody.meanings: To represent in a physical or concrete form; to incarnate or personify.

embrace.meanings: An act of putting arms around someone and bringing the person close to the chest; a hug.

embroider.meanings: To stitch a decorative design on fabric with needle and thread of various colours.

embryo.meanings: In the reproductive cycle, the stage after the fertilization of the egg that precedes the development into a fetus.

emergency.meanings: A situation which poses an immediate risk and which requires urgent attention.

emigrant.meanings: Someone who leaves a country to settle in a new country.

emission.meanings: Something which is emitted or sent out; issue.

emit.meanings: To send out or give off

emotion.meanings: A person's internal state of being and involuntary physiological response to an object or a situation, based on or tied to physical state and sensory data.

emotional.meanings: Of or relating to the emotions.

empathize.meanings: To feel empathy for another person

emperor.meanings: The male monarch or ruler of an empire.

emphasis.meanings: Special weight or forcefulness given to something considered important.

emphasize.meanings: To stress, give emphasis or extra weight to (something).

empire.meanings: (furniture) Following or imitating a style popular during the First French Empire (1804–1814).

empirical.meanings: Pertaining to or based on experience.

employ.meanings: The state of being an employee; employment.

employee.meanings: An individual who provides labor to a company or another person.

employer.meanings: A person, firm or other entity which pays for or hires the services of another person.

empty.meanings: (usually plural) A container, especially a bottle, whose contents have been used up, leaving it empty.

enable.meanings: To make somebody able (to do, or to be, something); to give sufficient ability or power to do or to be; to give strength or ability to.

enactment.meanings: The act of enacting, or the state of being enacted.

encase.meanings: To enclose, as in a case.

enchant.meanings: To attract and delight, to charm.

An invoice indicates that, unless paid in advance, payment is due by the buyer to the seller, according to the agreed terms.

mortgage.meanings: A special form of secured loan where the purpose of the loan must be specified to the lender, to purchase assets that must be fixed (not movable) property, such as a house or piece of farm land. The assets are registered as the legal property of the borrower but the lender can seize them and dispose of them if they are not satisfied with the manner in which the repayment of the loan is conducted by the borrower. Once the loan is fully repaid, the lender loses this right of seizure and the assets are then deemed to be unencumbered.
mortgage.definition: 抵押,抵押貸款,抵押,以…作擔保

It is a major class of hydrometeor, but it is distinguished from cloud, fog, dew, rime, frost, etc., in that it must fall. It is distinguished from cloud and virga in that it must reach the ground.

quotation.meanings: A fragment of a human expression that is repeated by somebody else. Most often a quotation is taken from literature or speech, but also scenes from a movie, elements of a painting, a passage of music, etc., may be quoted.

radiant.meanings: A point source from which radiation is emitted.

raffle.meanings: A drawing, often held as a fundraiser, in which tickets or chances are sold to win a prize.

raise.meanings: An increase in wages or salary; a rise (UK).

rake.meanings: A garden tool with a row of pointed teeth fixed to a long handle, used for collecting debris, grass, etc., for flattening the ground, or for loosening soil; also, a similar wheel-mounted tool drawn by a horse or a tractor.

rally.meanings: A public gathering or mass meeting that is not mainly a protest and is organized to inspire enthusiasm for a cause.

ramp.meanings: An inclined surface that connects two levels; an incline.

ranch.meanings: A large plot of land used for raising cattle, sheep or other livestock.

range.meanings: A line or series of mountains, buildings, etc.

rank-and-file.meanings: Enlisted soldiers in a military organization, as would be arrayed in a grid pattern with ranks and files.

rank.meanings: Strong of its kind or in character; unmitigated; virulent; thorough; utter (used of negative things).

rapport.meanings: A relationship of mutual trust and respect. A close and harmonious relationship in which the people or groups concerned understand each other's feelings or ideas and communicate well.

rash.meanings: Acting too quickly without considering the risks and consequences; not careful; hasty.

rating.meanings: To assign or be assigned a particular rank or level.

readership.meanings: The collected readers of a publication.

realistic.meanings: Expressed or represented as being accurate, practicable, or not idealistic.

realize.meanings: To make real; to convert from the imaginary or fictitious into reality; to bring into real existence

rear.meanings: To bring up to maturity, as offspring; to educate; to instruct; to foster.

rebate.meanings: A deduction from an amount that is paid; an abatement.

rebound.meanings: The recoil of an object bouncing off another.

recall.meanings: The action or fact of calling someone or something back.

recap.meanings: A tire that has had new tread glued on.

recede.meanings: To move back; to retreat; to withdraw.

receipt.meanings: The act of receiving, or the fact of having been received.

receiver.meanings: A person who or thing that receives or is intended to receive something. More formal, usually referring to one who receives such things as an award or medal.

receptionist.meanings: An employee (such as a secretary) who works in reception (receiving visitors and/or calls) for a person or business, especially an office.

recessional.meanings: Music played during a church recession.

recharge.meanings: Water that has percolated from the ground surface to an aquifer.

recipe.meanings: A formula for preparing or using a medicine; a prescription; also, a medicine prepared from such instructions.

reckless.meanings: Careless or heedless; headstrong or rash.

reclamation.meanings: The act of reclaiming or the state of being reclaimed.

recluse.meanings: A person who lives in self-imposed isolation or seclusion from the world, especially for religious purposes; a hermit

reclusive.meanings: Of, characterized by, or preferring privacy and isolation; secluded.

recognition.meanings: The act of recognizing or the condition of being recognized (matching a current observation with a memory of a prior observation of the same entity)

recognize.meanings: To match (something or someone which one currently perceives) to a memory of some previous encounter with the same person or thing.

recognized.meanings: To match (something or someone which one currently perceives) to a memory of some previous encounter with the same person or thing.

recollection.meanings: The act of recollecting, or recalling to the memory; the act of recalling to memory

recommend.meanings: To bestow commendation on; to represent favourably; to suggest, endorse or encourage as an appropriate choice.

reconcile.meanings: To restore a friendly relationship; to bring back to harmony.

record.meanings: A disk, usually made of a polymer, used to record sound for playback on a phonograph.

recruit.meanings: A supply of anything wasted or exhausted; a reinforcement.

rectify.meanings: To heal (an organ or part of the body).

recur.meanings: To have recourse (to) someone or something for assistance, support etc.

recurring.meanings: To have recourse (to) someone or something for assistance, support etc.

redeem.meanings: To recover ownership of something by buying it back.

redeemable.meanings: A financial instrument that can be redeemed.

redemption.meanings: The act of redeeming or something redeemed.

reduction.meanings: The act, process, or result of reducing.

referral.meanings: The act or process of transferring someone or something to another, of sending by reference, or referring.

refinance.meanings: To renew the terms of a loan.

refined.meanings: To purify; reduce to a fine, unmixed, or pure state; to free from impurities.

reflection.meanings: The act of reflecting or the state of being reflected.

refreshment.meanings: The action of refreshing; a means of restoring strength, energy or vigour.

refreshments.meanings: The action of refreshing; a means of restoring strength, energy or vigour.

refuel.meanings: An act or instance of refilling with fuel.

refurbish.meanings: To rebuild or replenish with all new material; to restore to original (or better) working order and appearance.

regimen.meanings: Orderly government; system of order; administration.

register.meanings: A machine that tabulates the amount of sales transactions, makes a permanent and cumulative record of them, and has a drawer in which cash can be kept.

registered mail.meanings: A special type of mail that provides more control than regular mail.

registrar.meanings: An official keeper or recorder of records.

regress.meanings: The act of passing back; passage back; return; retrogression.

regret.meanings: Emotional pain on account of something done or experienced in the past, with a wish that it had been different; a looking back with dissatisfaction or with longing.

rehabilitation.meanings: The process of rehabilitating somebody or something.

rehearse.meanings: To repeat, as what has been already said; to tell over again; to recite.

reimburse.meanings: To compensate with payment; especially, to repay money spent on one's behalf.

reinforce.meanings: To strengthen, especially by addition or augmentation.

reject.definition: 被拋棄的東西,瑕疵品,拒絕,駁回

relate.meanings: To tell in a descriptive way.

relative.meanings: Someone in the same family; someone connected by blood, marriage, or adoption.

release.meanings: The event of setting (someone or something) free (e.g. hostages, slaves, prisoners, caged animals, hooked or stuck mechanisms).

relent.definition: 變溫和,變寬容,不再拒絕

relentless.definition: 持續嚴厲的,持續強烈的

relevant.meanings: Directly related, connected, or pertinent to a topic.

reliance.meanings: The act of relying (on or in someone or something); trust.

relief.meanings: The removal of stress or discomfort.

relinquish.meanings: To give up, abandon or retire from something. To trade away.

relocate.meanings: To move (something) from one place to another.

relocation.meanings: The act of moving from one place to another.

remain.meanings: (chiefly in the plural) That which is left; relic; remainder.

remainder.meanings: A part or parts remaining after some has/have been removed.

remark.meanings: An act of pointing out or noticing; notice or observation.

remembrance.meanings: The act of remembering; a holding in mind, or bringing to mind; recollection.

remission.meanings: A pardon of a sin; the forgiveness of an offence, or relinquishment of a (legal) claim or a debt.

remit.meanings: Terms of reference; set of responsibilities; scope.

remodel.meanings: To change the appearance, layout, or furnishings of.

remuneration.meanings: Something given in exchange for goods or services rendered.

render.meanings: Stucco or plaster applied to walls (mostly to outside masonry walls).

renewable.meanings: A thing that is renewable; especially, a renewable source of energy.

renovate.meanings: To renew; to revamp something to make it look new again.

repel.meanings: To turn (someone) away from a privilege, right, job, etc.

replace.meanings: To restore to a former place, position, condition, etc.; to put back

represent.meanings: To present again or anew; to present by means of something standing in the place of; to exhibit the counterpart or image of; to typify.

reprimand.meanings: A severe, formal or official reproof; reprehension, rebuke, private or public.

reproduce.meanings: To produce an image or copy of.

require.meanings: To ask (someone) for something; to request.

rescind.meanings: To repeal, annul, or declare void; to take (something such as a rule or contract) out of effect.

rescue.meanings: An act or episode of rescuing, saving.

resemble.meanings: To be like or similar to (something); to represent as similar.

reservist.meanings: A soldier who is assigned as reserved; after training, no longer in full active duty.

reservoir.meanings: A place where anything is kept in store

residence.meanings: The place where one lives; one's home.

residual.meanings: A remainder left over at the end of some process.

resolve.definition: 解決,分解,剛毅,決心,下定決心

resonate.meanings: To vibrate or sound, especially in response to another vibration.

resort.meanings: A place where people go for recreation, especially one with facilities such as lodgings, entertainment, and a relaxing environment.

resource.meanings: Something that one uses to achieve an objective, e.g. raw materials or personnel.

respective.meanings: Relating to particular persons or things, each to each; particular; own.

respectively.meanings: In a relative manner; often used when comparing lists, where the term denotes that the items in the lists correspond to each other in the order they are given.

respondent.meanings: One who responds; one who replies.

restraint.meanings: Something that restrains, ties, fastens or secures

restricted.meanings: To restrain within boundaries; to limit; to confine

retain.meanings: To keep in possession or use.

retaliation.meanings: Violent or otherwise punitive response to an act of harm or perceived injustice; a hitting back; revenge.

retention.meanings: The act of retaining or something retained

reticent.meanings: Keeping one's thoughts and opinions to oneself; reserved or restrained.

retire.meanings: The act of retiring, or the state of being retired.

retrieval.meanings: The act of retrieving or something retrieved

reunion.meanings: The process or act of reuniting.

reveal.meanings: The outer side of a window or door frame; the jamb.

reverence.meanings: Veneration; profound awe and respect, normally in a sacred context.

review.meanings: A second or subsequent reading of a text or artifact in an attempt to gain new insights.

revised.meanings: To look at again, to reflect on.

revive.meanings: To return to life; to become reanimated or reinvigorated.

revoke.meanings: The act of revoking in a game of cards.

rewarding.meanings: To give a reward to or for.

ripening.meanings: To grow ripe; to become mature (said of grain, fruit, flowers etc.)

risk.meanings: A possible adverse event or outcome

rivalry.meanings: An ongoing relationship between (usually two) rivals who compete for superiority.

rogue.meanings: A scoundrel, rascal or unprincipled, deceitful, and unreliable person.

rotten.meanings: Of perishable items, overridden with bacteria and other infectious agents.

rudiment.meanings: (often in the plural) A fundamental principle or skill, especially in a field of learning.

ruins.meanings: (sometimes in the plural) The remains of a destroyed or dilapidated construction, such as a house or castle.

runoff.meanings: That portion of precipitation or irrigation on an area which does not infiltrate or evaporate, but instead is discharged from the area.

salient.meanings: An outwardly projecting part of a fortification, trench system, or line of defense.

salvage.meanings: The rescue of a ship, its crew or its cargo from a hazardous situation.

sanctuary.meanings: A place of safety, refuge or protection.

sanitation.meanings: The hygienic disposal or recycling of waste.

satisfaction.meanings: A fulfilment of a need or desire.

satisfy.meanings: To do enough for; to meet the needs of; to fulfill the wishes or requirements of.

saturation.meanings: The act of saturating or the process of being saturated

savor.meanings: The specific taste or smell of something.

say.meanings: A chance to speak; the right or power to influence or make a decision.

scaffold.meanings: A structure made of scaffolding for workers to stand on while working on a building.

scarce.meanings: Uncommon, rare; difficult to find; insufficient to meet a demand.

scatterbrained.meanings: Having the qualities of a scatterbrain: absent-minded, forgetful, easily distracted.

scenario.meanings: An outline of the plot of a dramatic or literary work.

schedule.meanings: A slip of paper; a short note.

scout.meanings: A person sent out to gain and bring in tidings; especially, one employed in war to gain information about the enemy and ground.

scrap.meanings: A (small) piece; a fragment; a detached, incomplete portion.

scratch.meanings: A disruption, mark or shallow cut on a surface made by scratching.

screening.meanings: To filter by passing through a screen.

scrutinize.meanings: To examine something with great care or detail, as to look for hidden or obscure flaws.

scrutiny.meanings: Intense study of someone or something.

sculpture.meanings: A three dimensional work of art created by shaping malleable objects and letting them harden or by chipping away pieces from a rock (sculpting).

search.definition: 探索,調查,仔細檢查,搜索

searing.meanings: To char, scorch, or burn the surface of (something) with a hot instrument.

season.meanings: Each of the four divisions of a year: spring, summer, autumn (fall) and winter

seasonal.meanings: Anything that is seasonal, such as a financial trend, a product for sale, or an employee.

seasoned.meanings: To make fit for any use by time or habit; to habituate; to accustom; to inure.

secluded.meanings: To shut off or keep apart, as from company, society, etc.; withdraw (oneself) from society or into solitude.

section.meanings: A cutting; a part cut out from the rest of something.
