senior citizen.meanings: An old person, variously considered to be a person over fifty, fifty-five, sixty, or sixty-five years of age.

sense.meanings: Any of the manners by which living beings perceive the physical world: for humans sight, smell, hearing, touch, taste.

sentimental.meanings: Characterized by sentiment, sentimentality or excess emotion.

separate.meanings: (usually in the plural) Anything that is sold by itself, especially an article of clothing.

service.meanings: An act of being of assistance to someone.

shovel.meanings: A hand tool with a handle, used for moving portions of material such as earth, snow, and grain from one place to another, with some forms also used for digging. Not to be confused with a spade, which is designed solely for small-scale digging and incidental tasks such as chopping of small roots.

showcase.meanings: A case for displaying merchandise or valuable items.

showing.meanings: To display, to have somebody see (something).

sightseeing.meanings: To go sightseeing; to visit places of interest in a city, town or geographical area.

signage.meanings: Signs, particularly those imparting commercial, directional, or road traffic information, taken collectively.

signify.meanings: To create a sign out of something.

silent.meanings: That which is silent; a time of silence.

simmer.meanings: The state or process of simmering.

simplicity.meanings: The state or quality of being simple

sizzling.meanings: To make the sound of water hitting a hot surface.

sketch.meanings: A rapidly executed freehand drawing that is not intended as a finished work, often consisting of a multitude of overlapping lines.

skill.meanings: Capacity to do something well; technique, ability. Skills are usually acquired or learned, as opposed to abilities, which are often thought of as innate.

skim milk.meanings: Non-fat milk; milk that has had the cream removed.

skirmish.meanings: A brief battle between small groups, usually part of a longer or larger battle or war.

skirt.meanings: An article of clothing, usually worn by women and girls, that hangs from the waist and covers the lower part of the body.

slag.meanings: Waste material from a coal mine

slander.meanings: A false or unsupported, malicious statement (spoken, not written), especially one which is injurious to a person's reputation; the making of such a statement.

slantwise.meanings: Diagonal, in a direction or orientation between cardinal axes

slash.meanings: A slashing action or motion, particularly:

sleek.definition: （尤指頭髮、衣服）平滑發亮的,整潔的,（外形）線條流暢的

slip.meanings: A thin, slippery mix of clay and water.

sluggish.meanings: Habitually idle and lazy; slothful; dull; inactive

smirk.meanings: An uneven, often crooked smile that is insolent, self-satisfied or scornful

smooth.meanings: Something that is smooth, or that goes smoothly and easily.

smudge.meanings: A blemish or smear, especially a dark or sooty one.

snowfall.meanings: An instance of falling of snow.

society.meanings: A long-standing group of people sharing cultural aspects such as language, dress, norms of behavior and artistic forms.

software.meanings: Encoded computer instructions, usually modifiable (unless stored in some form of unalterable memory such as ROM).

solace.meanings: Comfort or consolation in a time of loneliness or distress.

solar.meanings: Of or pertaining to the sun; proceeding from the sun

solicitation.meanings: The action or instance of soliciting; petition; proposal

solidarity.meanings: A bond of unity or agreement between individuals, united around a common goal or against a common enemy, such as the unifying principle that defines the labor movement; mutual support within a group.

solitary.meanings: One who lives alone, or in solitude; an anchoret, hermit or recluse.

solution.meanings: A homogeneous mixture, which may be liquid, gas or solid, formed by dissolving one or more substances.

solvency.meanings: The state of having enough funds or liquid assets to pay all of one's debts; the state of being solvent.

solvent.meanings: A liquid that dissolves a solid, liquid, or gaseous solute, resulting in a solution.

souvenir.meanings: An item of sentimental value, to remember an event or location.

sparingly.meanings: In a sparing manner; with frugality, moderation, scantiness, reserve, forbearance, or the like; sparsely.

sparsely.meanings: In a scattered or sparse manner; widely apart; thinly.

specialty.meanings: That in which one specializes; a chosen expertise or talent.

specimen.meanings: An individual instance that represents a class; an example.

spectrum.meanings: A range; a continuous, infinite, one-dimensional set, possibly bounded by extremes.

speculate.meanings: To think, meditate or reflect on a subject; to consider, to deliberate or cogitate.

speculation.meanings: The process of thinking or meditating on a subject.

sporadic.meanings: (of diseases) occurring in isolated instances; not epidemic.

sprain.meanings: The act or result of spraining; lameness caused by spraining

spy.meanings: A person who secretly watches and examines the actions of other individuals or organizations and gathers information on them (usually to gain an advantage).

square.meanings: A polygon with four sides of equal length and four right angles; an equilateral rectangle; a regular quadrilateral.

squirt.meanings: An instrument from which a liquid is forcefully ejected in a small, quick stream.

stable.meanings: A building, wing or dependency set apart and adapted for lodging and feeding (and training) animals with hoofs, especially horses.

stadium.meanings: A venue where sporting events are held.

staffing.meanings: To supply (a business, volunteer organization, etc.) with employees or staff members.

It is used as a food, in the production of commercial grape sugar, for stiffening linen in laundries, in making paste, etc.

warping.meanings: To twist or become twisted, physically or mentally:

warranty.meanings: A guarantee that a certain outcome or obligation will be fulfilled; security.

warrior.meanings: A person who is actively engaged in battle, conflict or warfare; a soldier or combatant.

watershed.meanings: The topographical boundary dividing two adjacent catchment basins, such as a ridge or a crest.

weakly.meanings: Frail, sickly or of a delicate constitution; weak.

weighs.meanings: To determine the weight of an object.

welfare.meanings: Health, safety, happiness and prosperity; well-being in any respect.

well-intentioned.meanings: Having good intentions, even if producing unfortunate results.

wharf.meanings: A man-made landing place for ships on a shore or river bank.

wheel.meanings: A circular device capable of rotating on its axis, facilitating movement or transportation or performing labour in machines.

wheelbarrow.meanings: A small, one-wheeled (rarely two-wheeled) cart with handles at one end for transporting small loads.

whereas.meanings: A clause, as in legal documents, stating whereas.

while.meanings: An uncertain duration of time, a period of time.

whine.meanings: A long-drawn, high-pitched complaining cry or sound

wholesome.meanings: Promoting good physical health and well-being.

whopping.meanings: To throw or move (something) quickly, usually with an impact.

wilderness.meanings: An unsettled and uncultivated tract of land in its natural state; a barren land; a wild or waste.

windshield.meanings: A transparent screen made of glass, located at the front and back of a vehicle in front of its occupants to protect them from the wind and weather.

winery.meanings: A place where wine is made, or a company that makes wine.

wing.meanings: An appendage of an animal's (bird, bat, insect) body that enables it to fly; a similar fin at the side of a ray or similar fish

wipe out.meanings: To destroy (especially, a large number of people or things); to obliterate.

wire.meanings: Metal formed into a thin, even thread, now usually by being drawn through a hole in a steel die.

withdraw.meanings: To pull (something) back, aside, or away.

withdrawal.meanings: Receiving from someone's care what one has earlier entrusted to them. Usually refers to money.

withhold.meanings: To keep (a physical object that one has obtained) to oneself rather than giving it back to its owner.

witness.meanings: Attestation of a fact or event; testimony.

word-of-mouth.meanings: Verbal means of passing on information.

workforce.meanings: All the workers employed by a specific organization or state, or on a specific project

working order.meanings: (especially of machinery) The state or condition of being operational or of functioning acceptably.

workload.meanings: The amount of work assigned to a particular worker, normally in a specified time period

workshop.meanings: A room, especially one which is not particularly large, used for manufacturing or other light industrial work.

worn-out.meanings: Damaged due to hard or continued use or exposure until no longer useful or effective.

worthwhile.meanings: Good and important enough to spend time, effort, or money on.

wrap up.meanings: To cover or enclose (something) by folding and securing a covering entirely around it.

wrap.meanings: To enclose (an object) completely in any flexible, thin material such as fabric or paper.

wreak.meanings: To cause something harmful; to afflict; to inflict; to harm or injury; to let out something harmful; .

wrench.meanings: A movement that twists or pulls violently; a tug.

write-down.meanings: A depreciation, or a lowering in the price or value of something

write-off.meanings: To reduce the book value of (an asset) to zero.

write-up.meanings: A written account of something, as a record.

yacht.meanings: A slick and light ship for making pleasure trips or racing on water, having sails but often motor-powered. At times used as a residence offshore on a dock.

yeast.meanings: An often humid, yellowish froth produced by fermenting malt worts, and used to brew beer, leaven bread, and also used in certain medicines.

yield.meanings: To pay, give in payment; repay, recompense; reward; requite.
yield.definition: 收益,利潤,收穫量,產生收益

zone.meanings: Each of the five regions of the earth's surface into which it was divided by climatic differences, namely the torrid zone (between the tropics), two temperate zones (between the tropics and the polar circles), and two frigid zones (within the polar circles).
